EN EN COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES Brussels, 3.7.2009 SEC(2009) 913 final COMMISSION STAFF WORKING DOCUMENT "Presentation of committee activities in 2008 by policy sectors" Accompanying the REPORT FROM THE COMMISSION ON THE WORKING OF COMMITTEES DURING 2008 {COM(2009) 335 final}

EN 3 EN I NTRODUCTION This working document contains snapshots of the activities of the committees in each policy sectors and includes the relevant data for all the committees in a sector for the year 2008. All individual committees under the responsibility of each Commission department are listed (whether they are active or not). This approach provides for transparency in the policy sector activities. In addition, the textual comments below each table highlight important changes in the organisation of the committees (e.g. creation, transfer or abolition of committees and procedures etc.) as well as cases referred to the Council (in the event of an unfavourable opinion or absence of opinion of the committee) and cases, subject to the regulatory procedure with scrutiny, in which the European Parliament or the Council have opposed the adoption of a measure, during the year in question. Explanatory remarks: The following explanations are intended to help the reader to better understand the statistical data, and in particular, why the total number of favourable opinions may differ from the total number of measures adopted in a specific sector: Opinions delivered by the committees may concern various types of measures: they may concern draft Commission acts (directives, regulations), decisions designed to regulate a specific legal situation or decisions to approve financial projects in the context of one of the many Community programmes. In the event of a favourable opinion , the rule is that the Commission adopts the implementing measure; under the management procedure it may also adopt an implementing measure in the absence of an opinion (shown in the ‘no opinion’ column, although a formal voting has taken place 1 ) and under the advisory procedure , it may also adopt an implementing measure in the event of a negative opinion of the committee. Only if there is an unfavourable opinion or no opinion under the regulatory procedure and the regulatory procedure with scrutiny is a proposal relating to the measure submitted to the Council, which then has the power to decide ( referrals to the Council). In addition, under the regulatory procedure with scrutiny , the European Parliament or the Council can oppose the adoption of a draft measure, even where there is a positive opinion of the committee. Furthermore, the total number of favourable opinions delivered by committees can be different from the number of implementing measures adopted by the Commission in a given sector when opinions are delivered one year but the instruments are not adopted until the following year. In certain cases committees are required to deliver opinions on matters which will not be the subject of a draft implementing measure until some time later. Therefore, in light of the above, there may be considerable discrepancies between the total number of opinions and the number of implementing measures adopted by the Commission. A number of committees had no activity at all in the reporting year. This is indicated by the figure “0” in all columns. It is, however, possible that a committee did not meet at all in the reporting year, 1 This situation occurs if neither the necessary quorum for a favourable , nor for an unfavourable opinion has been reached as a result of the vote.
EN 4 EN but delivered formal opinions on which it voted by written procedure, according to the rules of procedure of the committee.

Repealed by Decision No 1786/2002/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 23 September 2002 adopting a programme of Community action in the field of public health (2003-2008). Repealed as of 1 June 2008 by Article 139 of Regulation (EC) No 1907/2006 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 18 December 2006 concerning the Registration, Evaluation, Authorisation and Restriction of Chemicals (REACH), establishing a European Chemicals Agency, amending Directive 1999/45/EC and repealing Council Regulation (EEC) No 793/93 and Commission Regulation (EC) No 1488/94 as well as Council Directive 76/769/EEC and Commission Directives 91/155/EEC, 93/67/EEC, 93/105/EC and 2000/21/EC New procedures attributed to existing committee(s): – C11300 - Committee for implementing the directive establishing a Community policy regarding water - Attribution of regulatory procedure with scrutiny under Directive 2000/60/EC (priority alignment) – C12200 - Committee for the adaptation to technical progress and implementation of the directive on the deliberate release into the environment of genetically modified organisms - Attribution of regulatory procedure with scrutiny under Directive 2001/18/EC (priority alignment) – C13900 - Standing Committee for implementation of the directive concerning the placing of biocidal products on the market - Attribution of regulatory procedure with scrutiny under Directive 1998/8//EC (priority alignment) – C11700 - Committee for the adaptation to scientific and technical progress and implementation of the directives on waste - Attribution of regulatory procedure with scrutiny under Directive 2000/53/EC, Directive 2002/96/EC and Directive 2002/95/EC (priority alignment)

EN 55 EN Cases referred to the Council, specification of outcome of Council meeting and date/reference of adoption: - C11700 - Committee for the adaptation to scientific and technical progress and implementation of the directives on waste Draft measure concerned: Commission regulation amending Annexes IV and V to Regulation (EC) No 850/2004 of the European Parliament and of the Council as regards the treatment of waste containing persistent organic pollutants in thermal and metallurgical production processes Related basic legal act: Regulation (EC) No 850/2004 (POPs) Date of vote: 7 May 2008 Result of vote: No opinion, a qualified majority was not reached. Outcome of the Council meeting: No reaction from the Council within three months after submission of the file to the Council. The Commission is preparing the adoption of the regulation. - C12200 - Regulatory Committee on the deliberate release of GMOs into the environment. Draft measure concerned: Draft Commission Decision concerning the placing on the market, in accordance with Directive 2001/18/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council, of a carnation (Dianthus caryophyllus L., line 123.8.12) genetically modified for flower colour. Related basic legal act: Directive 2001/18/EC Date of vote: 15 September 2008 Result of vote: No opinion, a qualified majority was not reached. Outcome of the Council meeting: The Council (AGRI Council on 19 January) has neither adopted the proposed implementing act nor indicated its opposition to the proposal within the three-months period. As a consequence, the Commission adopted the draft Decision on 16 March 2009. Resolutions adopted by the European Parliament: - C34200 – REACH Committee Draft measure concerned: Draft Commission Regulation laying down test methods pursuant to Regulation (EC) No 1907/2006 of the European Parliament and of the Council on the Registration, Evaluation, Authorisation and Restriction of Chemicals (REACH) Related basic legal act: Regulation (EC) No 1907/2006 Date of vote: 31 October 2007 Procedure: Regulatory with scrutiny The European Parliament adopted a resolution on 22 May 2008 indicating that it would not oppose the adoption of the draft Commission Regulation in the light of the commitment received from the Commission to make certain arrangements to streamline and speed up the Commission's internal procedures for the validation and regulatory acceptance of new alternative test methods.

EN 56 EN Decisions by the EP / Council opposing draft measures under RPS: – C13900 - Standing Committee for implementation of the directive concerning the placing of biocidal products on the market The Council (JAI Council on 24 July 2008) opposed the adoption of five RPS draft measures (draft directives) on the grounds that the Commission had exceeded its implementing powers provided for in Directive 1998/8/EC. As a consequence, the Commission did not adopt the draft measures and submitted them in an amended version to the Standing Committee in February 2009. Draft measures concerned: Draft Commission Directive amending Directive 98/8/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council to include alphachloralose as an active substance in Annex I thereto Draft Commission Directive amending Directive 98/8/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council to include bromadiolone as an active substance in Annex I thereto Draft Commission Directive amending Directive 98/8/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council to include aluminium phosphide releasing phosphine as an active substance in Annex I thereto Draft Commission Directive amending Directive 98/8/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council to include indoxacarb as an active substance in Annex I thereto Draft Commission Directive amending Directive 98/8/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council to include thiacloprid as an active substance in Annex I thereto - C11300 - Committee for implementing the directive establishing a Community policy regarding water The Council (JAI Council on 24 July 2008) opposed the adoption of the draft measure on the grounds that the Commission had exceeded its implementing powers provided for in Directive 2000/60/EC. As a consequence, the Commission did not adopt the draft measures and submitted an amended version to the Committee in February 2009. Draft measure concerned: Draft Commission Directive laying down, pursuant to Directive 2000/60/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council, technical specifications for chemical analysis and monitoring of water status

EN 102 EN Draft measure concerned: the draft Commission decisions establishing an Annual Action Programme for Brazil (CMTD(2008)0263 - D000422/01) Related basic legal act: Regulation (EC) 1905/2006 Date of vote: 10/06/2008 Procedure: Management Draft measure concerned: the draft Commission decisions establishing an Annual Action Programme for Argentina (CMTD(2008)0263 - D000421/01) Related basic legal act: Regulation (EC) 1905/2006 Date of vote: 10/06/2008 Procedure: Management The European Parliament "Takes the view that the Commission, therewith, exceeds, in the AAP for Brazil for 2008 and in the AAP for Argentina for 2008, its implementing powers laid down in the basic act, given that the above-mentioned elements are not in compliance with Article 2(1) and (4) of Regulation (EC) No 1905/2006, as the primary objective of these elements is not the eradication of poverty, and as these elements do not fulfil the criteria for ODA established by the OECD/DAC". Follow-up: Commissioner Ferrero Waldner wrote to the Chairman of the Development Committee (Letter of 21 July 2008) expressing the opinion of the Commission that the EU components of the Erasmus Mundus External Cooperation Window are in compliance with the DCI regulation. The measure was adopted by the Commission on 13 August 2008.
